TypeSignature.Value: public ref class JustInTimeActivationAttribute sealed : Attribute
.class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit JustInTimeActivationAttribute extends System.Attribute
Public NotInheritable Class JustInTimeActivationAttribute Inherits Attribute

Docs.summary: Turns just-in-time (JIT) activation on or off. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If JIT activation is specified, then it must not be disabled in the COM+ catalog, and vice versa. If enabled in the COM+ catalog, it must be specified on the component.
JIT activation defaults to off for components which are configured in COM+, but is enabled automatically if automatic transactions are requested.
For more information about using attributes, see [Attributes](/dotnet/standard/attributes/).
## Examples The following code example demonstrates the use of this attribute.
:::code language="cpp" source="~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/EnterpriseServices_Pooling/CPP/inspector.cpp" id="Snippet0"::: :::code language="csharp" source="~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/EnterpriseServices_Pooling/CS/inspector.cs" id="Snippet0"::: :::code language="vb" source="~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/EnterpriseServices_Pooling/VB/inspector.vb" id="Snippet0":::

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. The parameterless constructor enables just-in-time (JIT) activation.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following code example creates a new <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.JustInTimeActivationAttribute>.
:::code language="csharp" source="~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/EnterpriseServicesJustInTimeActivationAttribute/CS/class1.cs" id="Snippet1"::: :::code language="vb" source="~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/EnterpriseServicesJustInTimeActivationAttribute/VB/class1.vb" id="Snippet1":::

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(bool val) cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class, optionally allowing the disabling of just-in-time (JIT) activation by passing as the parameter.

remarks.format:
## Remarks JIT activation is required and `val` cannot be set to `false` if the <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.TransactionOption> value for the transaction is `Supported`, `Required`, or `RequiresNew`.
## Examples The following code example creates a new <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.JustInTimeActivationAttribute>.
:::code language="csharp" source="~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/EnterpriseServicesJustInTimeActivationAttribute/CS/class1.cs" id="Snippet2"::: :::code language="vb" source="~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/EnterpriseServicesJustInTimeActivationAttribute/VB/class1.vb" id="Snippet2":::

Public ReadOnly Property Value As Boolean

Docs.summary: Gets the value of the setting.
Docs.value: if JIT activation is enabled; otherwise, . The default is .
